body:
Ok I have a question and so you know this is not an appeal I just have to know about how it works. So I got four day temp ban for profanity and yet as you can see in the photos below everyone else gets 1 day or a few hours ban. Now since this was a forums report there must be a video and I would ask if possible if I could see it just to know what I did wrong. When I was in game me CrafterPete and MLGPorky were fooling around in chat not being mean to anyone else but as joke towards each other. Anyway if any staff could comment below with the reason why mine ban was 4 days would be very helpful and if you could send me the video thanks.
-99
Just some examples
body_tagged:
Ok I have a question and so you know this is not an appeal I just have to know about how it works. So I got four day temp ban for profanity and yet as you can see in the photos below everyone else gets 1 day or a few hours ban. Now since this was a forums report there must be a video and I would ask if possible if I could see it just to know what I did wrong. When I was in game me CrafterPete and MLGPorky were fooling around in chat not being mean to anyone else but as joke towards each other. Anyway if any staff could comment below with the reason why mine ban was 4 days would be very helpful and if you could send me the video thanks.
-99
Just some examples
title: Please Help?

replies.body: Punishments vary on the level of how badly you were breaking the rules. Also, you could get a longer tempban if you had been punished for the same reason before, thus fairly receiving a longer punishment the next time.
replies.body_tagged: Punishments vary on the level of how badly you were breaking the rules. Also, you could get a longer tempban if you had been punished for the same reason before, thus fairly receiving a longer punishment the next time.

replies.body:
What he's trying to say is that if you've broken the rules multiple times, you'll get punished longer because the mods are concerned if you're punished for the same length each time, you'll just get back on break the rules, be banned again, repeat. 
Also, if you're badly breaking the rules, you're punishment will be longer than if you're not breaking the rules as badly. Example: if someone says "F*ck" in chat, they might get a short ban. If someone spams "F*CK YOU" in chat, they'll get a longer ban because they were acting more severely and being worse than the person who only cussed once.
replies.body_tagged:

Also, if you're badly breaking the rules, you're punishment will be longer than if you're not breaking the rules as badly. Example: if someone says "F*ck" in chat, they might get a short ban. If someone spams "F*CK YOU" in chat, they'll get a longer ban because they were acting more severely and being worse than the person who only cussed once.

replies.body:
First of all, when was this a damn strip club? Plus, 4 damn days for this little amount of profanity. Like, damn.

EDIT: So, let me get this straight. So, you temp ban me and a few others for profanity while we were just making a base that wasn't even supposed to be a strip club, the only thing that involved profanity about what we were doing is the fact that we had to keep our leather pants off, which really shouldn't result in a 4 day temp ban. BUT, you would only temp ban this one kid DRmom678 for only 2 damn hours and he did much MUCH more that what we did. This is completely stupid. I understand that different moderators have different feelings on what punishments they gave they should give to someone, but this is just stupid. This is not an appeal, but I hope you can understand.
replies.body_tagged:
First of all, when was this a damn strip club? Plus, 4 damn days for this little amount of profanity. Like, damn.

BUT, you would only temp ban this one kid DRmom678 for only 2 damn hours and he did much MUCH more that what we did. This is completely stupid. I understand that different moderators have different feelings on what punishments they gave they should give to someone, but this is just stupid. This is not an appeal, but I hope you can understand.

replies.body: To be honest, for all the people saying it depends on whether the mod is in a good mood or not, most staff don't give punishments depending on their mood. For example, if I'm happy IRL and someone is hacking I'm not going to tempban them instead of perm banning them. Same goes for most infractions. Also, Emerald may have a different opinion on what the punishment should be for profanity.

replies.body: The moderators shouldn't have certain feelings on what certain punishment should be given to some one for what they have done. Say some one repeatedly spams "F*ck" in chat and a moderator feels that it is necessary to temp ban that person for only 1 day. Someone could also spam "f*ck" and a different moderator will feel that it is necessary to permanent ban that player. That is unfair, and is basically what is going on now. There need to be specific punishments for what people do, not what the moderator feels should happen.
replies.body_tagged: The moderators shouldn't have certain feelings on what certain punishment should be given to some one for what they have done. Say some one repeatedly spams "F*ck" in chat and a moderator feels that it is necessary to temp ban that person for only 1 day. Someone could also spam "f*ck" and a different moderator will feel that it is necessary to permanent ban that player. That is unfair, and is basically what is going on now. There need to be specific punishments for what people do, not what the moderator feels should happen.

replies.body:
I agree. We need a strict set of punishments for every mod to follow.
Here is another example. I report someone for hacking on the forums. Nolan decides to perma-ban person. Then I post another report for hacking of the same kind, and alex decides to temp-ban 1 month. If we had a strict set of punishments, then no one would get lucky because they got a lenient moderator. Or no one would get unlucky because they got a strict moderator.
(not trying to bash alex, he is cool.)
replies.body_tagged:
I agree. We need a strict set of punishments for every mod to follow.
Here is another example. I report someone for hacking on the forums. Nolan decides to perma-ban person. Then I post another report for hacking of the same kind, and alex decides to temp-ban 1 month. If we had a strict set of punishments, then no one would get lucky because they got a lenient moderator. Or no one would get unlucky because they got a strict moderator.
(not trying to bash alex, he is cool.)

*Puts signs:
-Cockslapped
-I'm a good Stripper
-Important rule you take your pants off.


*Arranges wood into resembling a penis in a chest.

*Types in chat
-Pants off
-Pay me
-The Stripper is here
-Whacha gonna do with that big fat butt
-Tells players who come into the club repeatedly to take their pants off.
-Club name referencing to the KKK. 

"Ermahgerd im innocent emmy is teh strict mod!!11" "You shouldn't temp ban us because there are people who did it way more than us!" "We didn't do much!" 
Yeah right. Clean up your damn act. I highly disagree that you (referencing all the players that did the actions listed above) "didn't do much".  All of this is very inappropriate in my opinion. Also there are players that are YOUNG who come on Avicus and not only did you use profanity, but you made a subtle racist reference to the KKK. As for 99250, he punishment should not be as severe, but he still contributed so he should be punished along with the other players.
